alert.note: Alert for Prince George; Sussex (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 11 at 1:28PM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Greensville, southwestern Prince George, western Sussex and southeastern Dinwiddie Counties through 200 PM EST... At 127 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Jarratt, or near Purdy, moving north at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Purdy, Jarratt, Stony Creek, Carson, Owens, Templeton, Burgess, Reams, Fields Crossroads, Wharfs Store, Huske and Cowie Corner. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 300 PM EST for south central and southeastern Virginia.
